description:
This dataset provides high quality Climate Data Record (CDR) of multiple
cloud properties along with Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR)
Pathfinder Atmospheres Extended (PATMOS-x) brightness temperatures and
reflectances. These data have been fitted to a 0.1 x 0.1 equal angle-grid
with both ascending and descending assets generated daily from two to ten
NOAA and MetOp satellite passes per day.

This dataset includes 48 bands, 11 of which are deemed CDR quality
(marked with "CDR variable" in the band list).
The cloud products are derived using the ABI (Advanced Baseline Imager)
Cloud Height Algorithm (ACHA), and the Daytime Cloud Optical Properties
(DCOMP) algorithm. For more detail on the processing see the
[Climate Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document (C-ATBD)](
https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/pub/data/sds/cdr/CDRs/AVHRR-HIRS_Reflectance_PATMOS-x/AlgorithmDescription%20_01B-1c.pdf).
gee:terms_of_use:
The NOAA CDR Program's official distribution point for CDRs is NOAA's
National Climatic Data Center which provides sustained, open access and
active data management of the CDR packages and related information in
keeping with the United States' open data policies and practices as
described in the President's Memorandum on \"Open Data Policy\" and pursuant
to the Executive Order of May 9, 2013, \"Making Open and Machine Readable
the New Default for Government Information\". In line with these policies,
the CDR data sets are nonproprietary, publicly available, and no
restrictions are placed upon their use. For more information, see the
[Fair Use of NOAA's CDR Data Sets, Algorithms and Documentation](https://www1.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/data/sds/cdr/CDRs/Aerosol_Optical_Thickness/UseAgreement_01B-04.pdf)
pdf.

links.title: Run the example for NOAA/CDR/PATMOSX/V53 in the Earth Engine Code Editor

sci:citation:
For the TOA Reflectances and Brightness Temperatures users must cite:
Andrew K. Heidinger, Michael J. Foster, Andi Walther, Xuepeng Zhao, and
NOAA CDR Program (2014): NOAA Climate Data Record (CDR) of Reflectance
and Brightness Temperatures from AVHRR Pathfinder Atmospheres - Extended
(PATMOS-x), Version 5.3. [indicate subset used]. NOAA National Centers for
Environmental Information.
[doi:10.7289/V56W982J](https://doi.org/10.7289/V56W982J)
[access date].

sci:publications.citation:
For the cloud properties users must cite: Andrew K. Heidinger, Michael J.
Foster, Andi Walther, Xuepeng Zhao, and NOAA CDR Program (2014): NOAA
Climate Data Record (CDR) of Cloud Properties from AVHRR Pathfinder
Atmospheres - Extended (PATMOS-x), Version 5.3. [indicate subset used].
NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information.
[doi:10.7289/V5348HCK](https://doi.org/10.7289/V5348HCK)
[access date].

eo:bands.description: Cloud emissivity at 11µm, determined from ACHA (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: cld_emiss_acha

eo:bands.description: Cloud height computed using ACHA
eo:bands.name: cld_height_acha

eo:bands.description: Cloud height uncertainty computed using ACHA
eo:bands.name: cld_height_uncer_acha

eo:bands.description: Cloud optical depth at 0.65µm, determined from ACHA
eo:bands.name: cld_opd_acha

eo:bands.description: Cloud optical depth at 0.65µm, determined from DCOMP (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: cld_opd_dcomp

eo:bands.description: Uncertainty in the cloud optical depth at 0.65µm, determined from DCOMP
eo:bands.name: cld_opd_dcomp_unc

eo:bands.description: Cloud-top pressure computed using ACHA
eo:bands.name: cld_press_acha

eo:bands.description: Effective radius of cloud particles determined from ACHA
eo:bands.name: cld_reff_acha

eo:bands.description: Effective radius of cloud particles determined from DCOMP (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: cld_reff_dcomp

eo:bands.description: Uncertainty in the effective radius of cloud particle determined from DCOMP
eo:bands.name: cld_reff_dcomp_unc

eo:bands.description: Cloud-top temperature computed using ACHA (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: cld_temp_acha

eo:bands.description: Cloud fraction computed over a 3x3 pixel array at the native resolution centered on this pixel
eo:bands.name: cloud_fraction

eo:bands.description: Cloud fraction uncertainty computed over a 3x3 array
eo:bands.name: cloud_fraction_uncertainty

eo:bands.description: Probability of a pixel being cloudy from the Bayesian cloud mask
eo:bands.name: cloud_probability

eo:bands.description: Cloud transmission at 0.65µm from DCOMP
eo:bands.name: cloud_transmission_0_65um

eo:bands.description: Integer classification of the cloud type including clear and aerosol type
eo:bands.name: cloud_type

eo:bands.description: Integrated total cloud water over whole column
eo:bands.name: cloud_water_path

eo:bands.description: Land classes
eo:bands.name: land_class

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere reflectance 0.65µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: refl_0_65um

eo:bands.description: Instrument counts for the 0.65µm channel
eo:bands.name: refl_0_65um_counts

eo:bands.description:
Standard deviation of the 0.63µm reflectance computed over
a 3x3 pixel array
eo:bands.name: refl_0_65um_stddev_3x3

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere reflectance at 0.86µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: refl_0_86um

eo:bands.description: Instrument counts for the 0.86µm channel
eo:bands.name: refl_0_86um_counts

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere reflectance at 1.60µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: refl_1_60um

eo:bands.description: Instrument counts for the 1.60µm channel
eo:bands.name: refl_1_60um_counts

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere reflectance at 3.75µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: refl_3_75um

eo:bands.description: Sun-sensor relative azimuth angle; 0 is the principal plane looking towards sun
eo:bands.name: relative_azimuth_angle

eo:bands.description: Scan element index of the pixel chosen for inclusion in level-2b
eo:bands.name: scan_element_number

eo:bands.description: Scan line number
eo:bands.name: scan_line_number

eo:bands.description: Scan line time
eo:bands.name: scan_line_time

eo:bands.description: Sensor zenith for each pixel measured in degrees from nadir
eo:bands.name: sensor_zenith_angle

eo:bands.description: Snow classes and values
eo:bands.name: snow_class

eo:bands.description:
Solar azimuth angle in degrees from north, pixel to sun,
positive values are clockwise from north
eo:bands.name: solar_azimuth_angle

eo:bands.description:
Solar zenith for each pixel measured in degrees away from the
sun (0=looking at sun)
eo:bands.name: solar_zenith_angle

eo:bands.description: Surface temperature retrieved using atmospherically corrected 11µm radiance
eo:bands.name: surface_temperature_retrieved

eo:bands.description: UMD surface type
eo:bands.name: surface_type

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere brightness temperature at 11.0µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: temp_11_0um

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere brightness temperature modeled assuming clear skies at 11.0µm
eo:bands.name: temp_11_0um_clear_sky

eo:bands.description: Standard deviation of the 11.0µm brightness temperature computed over a 3x3 pixel array
eo:bands.name: temp_11_0um_stddev_3x3

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere brightness temperature 12.0µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: temp_12_0um

eo:bands.description: Top of atmosphere brightness temperature 3.75µm (CDR variable)
eo:bands.name: temp_3_75um

eo:bands.description: ACHA processing information bit flags
eo:bands.name: acha_info

eo:bands.description: ACHA quality flags
eo:bands.name: acha_quality

eo:bands.description: Mask that distinguishes good from bad pixels
eo:bands.name: bad_pixel_mask

eo:bands.description: Integer classification of the cloud mask
eo:bands.name: cloud_mask

eo:bands.description: Processing flags for DCOMP
eo:bands.name: dcomp_info

eo:bands.description: DCOMP processing information bit flags
eo:bands.name: dcomp_quality

eo:bands.description: Glint mask
eo:bands.name: glint_mask

title: NOAA CDR PATMOSX: Cloud Properties, Reflectance, and Brightness Temperatures, Version 5.3
